intro: Blepharis inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the plantain family, Plantaginaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the spring and early summer. Blepharis inaequalis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
